1596824289_19dzDaMFcuCusp4anMUPkVc8zRzLJ.body: I used to run a few nodes of this a while back. We had a crazy idea that we could link together the nodes in a big mesh network, maybe using LoRa as a range booster.

1597818504_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4.body: From what I understand, ZeroNet is actually a collection of p2p servers. Each server is run from ZeroNet.exe, and as long as there is a single user with that running, all zites and pages that the user has visited are available to everyone on the ZeroNet mesh. There is no "centralized" anything in ZeroNet afaik, just a bunch of users hosting local servers, downloading the entire domain they visit, and occasionally updating them as they leave the program open.
